column4: Thanks for the advice, I got the Ubuntu installation going now
The CD was definatly burned incorrectly.
The 1 odd thing about hte installation process to me was the partition/format dialog
I've used red-hat/debian/suse, and they all seem similar
Ubuntu's seems slightly different, and more confusing to me
Well, the partition/format is kind of built into 1 step, instead of 2
Maybe it'll just take some getting used to
I'm hoping it didn't format my /home partition
but I can't tell if it did or not, until instalation is doone
Did you tell it to?
Then it shouldn't have touched /home
Unplug the KVM and use 'Terminal Server Client' :-)
What kind of KVM is it btw? just a hardware switch or a proper powered one?
Applications -> Internet -> Terminal Server Client -> Connect to the windows box with the RDPv5 protocol.
The more expensive KVMs emulate the hardware for the box you're not switched to, so you don't get this sort of problem.
gdm wants to listen on a privileged port, and thus needs to run as root.
Playing with vnc?
yeah
'cvsd' is a chrooted version of cvs. You don't need it to run a normal cvs server.
Yes
and add the same cfg in inetd.conf or xinitd.conf
Check /etc/xinetd.d
what do you think the permissions should be?
